column4: can anybody please help me with getting rid of some installed packages. I cannot remove two packages which were not installed correctly durign a previous installation process.
trying "sudo apt-get purge -f" did not help
that doesn't help either. entering it doesnt give any information back, but the problem remains
no, nothing at all. i am working on kubuntu 9.04, if that may be of interest
then dpkg believes the packages were installed fully. Have you tried uninstalling them with the purge function? apt-get purge [package]
nothing of it works, both times the apt-get returns that no dir file was speciefied and thus it cannot go on
can you paste the error into a pastebin so we can see it?
brb, ask someone else for a while, sorry!!
sorry, i was away for a sec. look at http://paste.ubuntu.com/168156/, i have tried to translate my german output a little
I've suggested all I can think of, so at this point, try posting a message to ubuntu forums
